isis.stitle: INTERNATIONAL 4X2 AND 6X4 SPRING SUSPENSION WITH TORQUE RODS - SERVICE - EQUALIZER BEARING (BUSHING) REPLACEMENT - SUSPENSION ASSEMBLED

svcsubproc.title: Equalizer Bearing Removal
svcsubproc.para: Equalizer bearings (bushings) may be replaced without disassembling the suspension. Proceed as follows.

step1.para: Remove front and rear spring retaining pins from equalizer ( Figure 4and Figure 5).
Raise vehicle frame sufficiently to relieve weight from leaf spring assemblies allowing spring ends to drop clear of equalizer.

note.para: Use frame stands to support frame.

step1.para: Remove equalizer pivot bolt, nut and lockwasher from equalizer bracket ( Figure 4).
Tap or pry on back side of equalizer to produce clearance between equalizer and adapter.
To remove equalizer bearing, support equalizer in press and press bearing from equalizer using a 2.5 inch (63 mm) adapter. Adapters may be made locally from standard size tubing.

note.para: When removing or installing equalizer bearing, press on bearing outer sleeve only.

step1.para: To install equalizer bearing, apply a light coat of lubricant to outside diameter of bearing assembly, support equalizer in press and press bearing into equalizer. Bearing must be centered in equalizer.
